definition: to earn a living (esp. with negative)
to chat/to depend upon (literary)/temporarily/just/slightly
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
The people have no way to make a living (idiom, from Record of the Grand Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4])/no way of getting by

sentences.english: The people here are reduced to dire poverty because of (the) natural disasters.
sentences.chinese: 這裏的人們由於自然災害而窮不聊生。

sentences.english: Ming Wanghou, China is in the dark ages, the nobody expressing an opinion, the people have no means to make a living.
sentences.chinese: 明亡後，中國處於黑暗時代，萬馬齊喑，民不聊生。
